Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 14th overall pick, by Toledo in 1969...
Had first career hit on 4/3/1971, off Bob Gleich (MAN)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/26/1971, off Gaspar Salas (PG)...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/22/1974, hitting .429 with 4 HR, 11 RBI...
Injured on 5/3/1975 with a Ruptured Elbow Ligament, out for 4 weeks...
Drove in 6 runs against Northeastern on 9/21/1975...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/12/1976, hitting .381 with 4 HR, 12 RBI...
Was selected to the 1976 Allstar game...
Traded from Toledo to Pittsburgh on 2/12/1978 (Going to TOL: 3B R. Hearns, 2B P. Reaves. Going to PIT: 3B G. Freeman)...
Hit 3 homeruns against Bay City, driving in 4 runs on 6/21/1978...
Won World Championship with Pittsburgh in 1978...
Won World Championship with Pittsburgh in 1981...
Traded from Pittsburgh to Toledo on 1/31/1983 (Going to PIT: 3B L. Gothard, P G. Hutto. Going to TOL: 3B G. Freeman, P E. Harris)...
Injured on 4/14/1984 with a Strained Rotator Cuff Muscle, out for 5 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/9/1984, hitting .579 with 1 HR, 6 RBI...
Had 2000th career hit on 8/16/1985, off Bernard Valdovinos (Mal)...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/21/1987, hitting .565 with 4 HR, 6 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by Malibu on 2/10/1989 to a 2-year deal worth $2,094,400 per year...
